page.title: 15Games in Bury St. Edmunds.
page.content: In the Newmarket Road area of the block there is a tennis club, golf course, bowling green and facilities for snooker and badminton. People also play football, cricket and rounders on the open spaces where there are slides and swings. A favourite game is to get four people to stand on the four swings while two people stand on the ground, one each side of the swings. They throw a ball at the swingers who may only hit back with head or feet. If a swinger is hit on the body or arms, he or she is "out". Indoors, table-tennis and computer games are played. The popular games are draughts, chess, Cluedo, Monopoly, Scrabble and Battleships. From this district, people are only a short walk from the Sports Centre and Rollerbury, the roller skating rink.
